comments:
3.1M2, on W2K:

Right-click in the left margin of the java editor. The popup menu shows:

Toggle Breakpoint (enabled)
Disable Breakpoint (disabled)
Breakpoint Properties (disabled)
Toggle Breakpoint (enabled)
(divider)
rest of menu

Select either "Toggle Breakpoint". Eclipse spins up to 100% CPU consumption for
a few seconds and then produces the following in the error log:

Error okt 04, 2004 17:15:17.580

Marking as works for me. The fact that you have a 'no such method' exception 
looks suspicious - like you have an incomplete/currupt install of Eclipse.
